thread.title: A suspected car thief’s orange-and-white cat has ended a three-hour standoff in San Francisco. | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: A suspected car thief’s orange-and-white cat has ended a three-hour standoff in San Francisco. | DailyTelegraph

author: Network writers
title: A suspected car thief’s orange-and-white cat has ended a three-hour standoff in San Francisco. | DailyTelegraph
text:
A SUSPECTED car thief’s orange-and-white cat has ended a three-hour standoff in San Francisco.
The cat helped negotiators convince the man to step down from a third-story window ledge after he had threatened to jump.
Earlier standoff @ 10th & Harrison. Subj ran from stolen veh. #SFPD negotiators talked him down. #CHP made arrest pic.twitter.com/4dNoWup0ba
— CHP San Francisco (@CHPSanFrancisco) October 8, 2015 According to SF Gate , “Using his pet, hostage negotiators were able to persuade him to go back inside the building, come down the stairs and surrender without incident.”
When police learned the man’s relatives brought his cat to the scene, officers took it up to the negotiators.
“Using the cat was ingenious,” said a police spokesman, Albie Esparza. “Never underestimate the power of the love between people and their pets. I think it was great to think outside the box like the officers did. It made enough of an impact on this person to bring him down and come to his senses.”
Thks to #SFPD negotiators for resolving standoff from earlier #CHP foot bail. Suspect's cat helped to calm him pic.twitter.com/Mc5FJEBs4y
— CHP San Francisco (@CHPSanFrancisco) October 8, 2015 Officers had set up foam pads below the man as negotiators perched precariously on a fire escape. But within 45 minutes of the cat’s arrival, the three hour standoff was over.

Originally published as Cat saves suicidal car thief
